intro: Cracca brachycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited cracca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, and its fruits are distinctive for their broad, flattened shape. It is typically a low-growing perennial with finely divided leaves. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
